definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: She felt a bit comfortlessness to his licentious behavior.
sentences.chinese: 她對他放肆的行爲感到有點不舒服。

sentences.english: She was surprised by a wanton thought that rushed into her mind.
sentences.chinese: 一個放肆的念頭在她心裏閃過，叫她吃了一驚。

sentences.english: At the same time, I knew that in the theater in our hometown I would care.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，我知道在家鄉的劇院我就不能這麼放肆了。

sentences.english: In late spring, the flowers of rape are blossoming wildly, alluring swarms of butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 暮春的油菜花一片放肆，粉蝶轟轟其上。

sentences.english: I pray you, sir, what saucy merchant was this, that was so full of his ropery?
sentences.chinese: 先生，這個滿嘴胡說八道的放肆傢伙是誰？

sentences.english: She felt a little upset about her licentious behavior.
sentences.chinese: 她對他放肆的行爲感到有點不舒服。

sentences.english: She kissed with abandon but without haste.
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地吻我，卻並不匆忙。

sentences.english: It is too presumptuous of him to do so.
She feels a little uncomfortable about her licentious behavior.
sentences.chinese: 她對他放肆的行爲感到有點不舒服。

sentences.english: The man's familiar behavior angered the woman.
sentences.chinese: 這男子放肆的行爲觸怒了這位婦女。

sentences.english: We are into the mountains, trail running and hiking.
sentences.chinese: 我們去山林，放肆地奔跑攀越。

sentences.english: Whose lips have trembled with a maiden's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 能讓嘴脣對牧女的眼睛放肆。

sentences.english: This kind of freedom is licentious.
We must stand firm against their open and extremely aggressive tactics.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須堅定不移的反對他們極其放肆的公開策略。

sentences.english: He amazes me by his audacity .
sentences.chinese: 他的大膽放肆使我十分驚訝。

sentences.english: She felt a little unconfortable to his wlid behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她對他放肆的行爲感到有點不舒服。

definition: to display shockingly bad behavior/to behave atrociously
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
